io.spine.server.storage.memory

Class InMemoryInboxStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.AbstractStorage<io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessageId,io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessage,InboxReadRequest>
      • io.spine.server.storage.memory.InMemoryInboxStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.spine.logging.Logging, InboxStorage, Storage<io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessageId,io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessage,InboxReadRequest>, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class InMemoryInboxStorage
extends AbstractStorage<io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessageId,io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessage,InboxReadRequest>
implements InboxStorage, io.spine.logging.Logging
    In-memory implementation of messages stored in Inbox.

    Mutating operations are made synchronized to avoid simultaneous updates of the same records. That allows to operate in a concurrency-heavy environment notwithstanding the thread-safety of the underlying storage.

        public Page<io.spine.server.delivery.InboxMessage> readAll(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardIndex index,
                                                           int pageSize)
        Description copied from interface: InboxStorage
        Reads the contents of the storage by the given shard index and returns the first page of the results.

        The older items go first.

        Specified by:
        readAll in interface InboxStorage
        Parameters:
        index - the shard index to return the results for
        pageSize - the maximum number of the elements per page
        Returns:
        the first page of the results

        Description copied from interface: Storage
        Writes a record into the storage.

        Rewrites it if a record with this ID already exists in the storage.

        Description copied from interface: InboxStorage
        Removes the passed messages from the storage.

        Does nothing for messages that aren't in the storage already.
